result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian M. Meyers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:11 a.m. Defendant Ian M. Meyers in court, in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant statement that he contacted PD's office over a month ago - was appointed Attorney Breanna Magallones; believed it was for both new case and revocation. Off record - Court contacts PD's office - Attorney Magallones will be over shortly. Recess 10:15 a.m. 
On record - 10:38 a.m. - Attorney Breanna Magallones now present in court. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Court modifies bond in 17cm51 to include condition of No intoxicant; no taverns. Pfeifer/Magallones/Meyers/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence-each Count CC
Jail - 90 days 
Jail credit - 64 days
Any financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 10:48 a.m.
- includes cover letter and revocation summary

2:35 p.m. Defendant Ian M. Meyers in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Ian M. Meyers in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. State moves to amend Count 1 to disorderly conduct - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to both Counts.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. 
Adj. 2:43 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:00 p.m. Defendant Ian M. Meyers, in custody, in court via video with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan for Attorney Mary Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:01 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
No contact with victim, B.T. or K.T.; No intoxicants; no taverns

1:22 p.m. Defendant Ian M. Meyers in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:26 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
